question_sentence: Which Netflix series took home the most Emmys this week?
More than 60 endangered penguins were found dead in a South African town this week. What was responsible for their deaths?
choices: An influx of snakes in the area

question_sentence: This full, orange moon pictured below reliably appears every autumn. What type of moon is it?
Canadians voted to keep Justin Trudeau as prime minister Monday. When was he first elected into office?
Kansas City Royals star Salvador Perez set a single-season home run record for a catcher this week. Who previously held the record?
People who bought chicken in the last decade could get money back from a settlement stemming from a class-action lawsuit alleging:
Gabby Petito's case brings attention to the prevalence of domestic violence. How many women have experienced intimate partner violence, per CDC?
A 1,175-carat uncut diamond, believed to be the third-largest in the world, was unveiled in New York. Where was it found?
A tablet containing one of the oldest literary works will return to Iraq after a DOJ order. What did Hobby Lobby initially plan to do with it?
choices: Donate it to the National Christian Foundation
Promote it as part of a traveling exhibition at its stores
Display it in its Museum of the Bible
Give it to Donald Trump as a gift

question_sentence: About 46% of which group had at least five drinks in a week, according to a survey of U.S. adults conducted earlier this year?
Boris Johnson this week appeared to confirm that he had how many children?
evidence: Johnson has dodged the question for years, but when an NBC interviewer suggested during the prime minister’s trip to the US that the tally stood at half a dozen, Johnson replied: ‘Yes’

question_sentence: New research suggests that pandas living in areas where more than 80% of the landscape is perfectly habitable become too comfortable to do what?
evidence: US scientists concluded that some degree of discomfort could help save pandas from extinction by encouraging the bears to wander off in search of new mates. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: New Bond film No Time To Die, which hits UK cinema next week, takes the total tally of 007 films starring Daniel Craig to how many?
evidence: The much-delayed latest instalment in the franchise will be Craig’s last appearance as James Bond after 15 years as the superspy

question_sentence: Boris Johnson has responded to French anger over the new ‘Aukus’ defence pact between the UK, US and Australia by telling Emmanuel Macron to do what?
choices: Get a grip and give me a break
evidence: As Paris seethed over a cancelled submarine deal with Australia, Johnson told reporters in Washington that it was ‘time for some of our dearest friends around the world to prenez un grip about this and donnez-moi un break’

question_sentence: Who has been hired as the face of Rupert Murdoch’s latest venture, talkTV?
evidence: Murdoch is seeking to create a US-style news channel with a conservative tone that could challenge the floundering GB News

question_sentence: According to a new study from Cambridge University, England is on target to eliminate HIV transmission by which year?
evidence: Cambridge University and Public Health England said that the country is also on track to have diagnosed 95% of people with HIV by 2025

question_sentence: As Angela Merkel prepared to step down as chancellor this Sunday after choosing not to run in Germany’s national elections, she told Bloomberg that she plans to do what next?
choices: Run for president of the European Commission
Run for secretary-general of the United Nations
Return to her former job as a quantum chemist
evidence: ‘I have decided for myself that, first of all, I will do nothing and just wait for what comes up,’ Merkel told Bloomberg earlier this month

question_sentence: Keir Starmer has set out his vision for the future of the UK in a newly published essay that runs to how many words?
evidence: Titled ‘The Road Ahead’, the essay ‘sets Labour on course for centre ground’, said The Guardian. But critics claimed it was too long to be of interest to voters

question_sentence: The number of people aged 100 or more has risen by what percentage in a year, according to the Office for National Statistics?
evidence: The number of centenarians reached a record high of 15,120 last year, thanks to improvements in healthcare and quality of life, plus a hike in births in the year after the First World War

question_sentence: Some UK petrol stations have had to close this week as a result of fuel shortages caused by what?
choices: Blockades and strikes at oil refineries
Stockpiling by customers amid fresh lockdown fears
A sudden surge in global fuel prices
evidence: A handful of BP and Esso-owned Tesco Alliance stations across the UK had to shut temporarily after lorry driver shortages hit deliveries of petrol

question_sentence: Which major summit kicked off this week, bringing together more than 100 global leaders?
evidence: The UN General Assembly was held at the UN Headquarters in New York City. At the annual summit, leaders and diplomats discuss a wide variety of political, environmental and social issues facing the global community.

question_sentence: Which show took home the award for outstanding drama series at this year’s Emmy Awards?
evidence: Befitting its title, “The Crown” took home the crown for outstanding drama series at the 73rd Emmy Awards.

question_sentence: Which company is releasing a limited edition beer with an alcohol content so high that it’s illegal in 15 US states?
evidence: Samuel Adams will release its limited-edition “Utopias” brand, a beer packing 28% alcohol by volume, more than five times the potency of the average US brew.

question_sentence: Which Covid-19 vaccine manufacturer most recently reported that its vaccine saw a “robust” antibody response in children ages 5 to 11, based on data from trials?
evidence: Pfizer, along with partner BioNTech, announced the findings, saying its lower-dose vaccine was safe for children 5 to 11, putting it prime position to receive FDA emergency authorization for use within the age group – the first vaccine to do so – by the end of October.

question_sentence: The potential twelve-figure default of Evergrande, of one of the world’s largest conglomerates, sent shockwaves through world markets this week. Where is the firm based?
evidence: Evergrande, based in Shenzhen, China, is one of the biggest developers in the country and largest business conglomerates in the world, currently facing default worth nearly $300 billion.

question_sentence: The world’s tallest nation is getting a little shorter, scientists say. What, exactly, is the world’s tallest nation?
evidence: The Netherlands boasts the tallest people in the world, on average. But a recent study shows Dutch men and women born in 2001 were 1cm and 1.4cm shorter, respectively, than those born in 1980.

question_sentence: Actor Matthew McConaughey says he is considering a gubernatorial run in which state?
evidence: When asked on a recent episode of the “Set‌ ‌it‌ ‌Straight:‌ ‌Myths‌ ‌and‌ ‌Legends” podcast, McConaughey said he’s “measuring” a run in Texas, his native state.

question_sentence: According to a recent study in Sweden, more frequent consumption of what type of food appears to lower the risk of heart disease?
evidence: The Swedish study, corroborated with findings from 17 other international studies, found that people with a higher consumption of dairy fat have a lower risk of cardiovascular disease than those with lower intakes.

question_sentence: Which country’s prime minister will retain their seat after a controversial snap election this week?
evidence: Canada will see Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, head of the country’s Liberal Party, hang on to power following a race with the rival Conservative Party led by Erin O’Toole.

question_sentence: US President Joe Biden spoke with French President Emmanuel Macron for the first time since the announcement of AUKUS – a strategic partnership between the US, UK and Australia. France has balked at the partnership, which includes what key provision?
evidence: Submarine sales are at the heart of the controversy. The US has agreed to provide Australia with nuclear-powered submarines, which means France could lose nearly $65 billion in an existing deal to provide Australia with conventional, diesel-based submarines.
